definition: A term used to describe a group or individuals who hold differing views, opinions, or beliefs from those in power or the dominant group within a society. This term is commonly used in political contexts to refer to the opposing party or parties that challenge the ruling party's policies, decisions, or ideologies. It can also be used more broadly to describe any form of dissent or resistance against established norms, systems, or authorities.

examples.german: Die Opposition hat den Gesetzentwurf abgelehnt.
Die Oppositionspartei hat bei den Wahlen verloren.
examples.english: The opposition party lost in the elections.
The opposition demands a new election.
The opposition politicians criticize the government.
